items.title: Campers told to reconsider travel as severe weather lashes NSW south coast
items.summary: Campers have been evacuated from low-lying areas as damaging wet weather makes its way along the NSW south coast.

items.title: Australian who escaped Iran recalls protesters being shot and says the crackdown is 'different this time'
items.summary: On a visit to his home town outside Tehran, this Iranian Australian joined the protests last Thursday night, then the regime's suppression methods turned from tear gas to live fire.

items.title: Castlemaine family flees Wye River flood days after Harcourt bushfire evacuation
items.summary: A family holidaying at Wye River on the Great Ocean Road have been lucky to escape flash flooding less than a week after catastrophic fires drove them from their central Victorian home.

items.title: North Queensland redclaw farmer looks to science to meet overwhelming resturant demand
items.summary: The freshwater crayfish is becoming more popular in restaurants across Australia, but the industry faces challenges boosting production as more farmers retire.

items.title: Four more pipe bombs found in north-west Canberra as police investigation continues
items.summary: ACT police say they have found four more pipe bombs in the Belconnen area, after 11 explosive devices were discovered close to Lake Ginninderra earlier in the week.

items.title: US legal case against Amazon Prime subscription service leads to cheque in the mail for Australian
items.summary: Australian woman Laura Wells was confused to find an "official-looking letter" from the US with a $51 reimbursement, but it turns out it was legitimate.

items.title: Twenty-four parkruns in 24 hours no sweat for Albany runner Ben Castlehow
items.summary: An Albany man runs roughly three marathons in laps of a hilly parkrun to raise funds for a charity that helped him through a tough time.

items.title: World champion Shelley Taylor-Smith runs swim group for women at Mettams Pool
items.summary: They call themselves the "Sea Shells Teabaggers" — and with marathon swimmer Shelley Taylor-Smith at the helm, this ocean swim group has built something much stronger than good technique.

items.title: Machado says she presented Trump with her Nobel Peace Prize medal.
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Artificial reefs among options in coastal SA town's erosion battle
items.summary: As erosion threatens roads and even homes in Robe in South Australia, artificial reefs and other options are on the table to fight back.

items.title: US says Iran has halted executions but 'all options remain on the table'
items.summary: The White House says it will hold off on military action in Iran after the regime halted executions, but "all options remain on the table" if the killing of protesters continues.

items.title: WA farmers grapple with three-month BOM radar outage ahead of planting season
items.summary: A key weather radar in WA's north is expected to be offline for at least three months, leaving farmers and pastoralists facing financial losses and safety risks.

items.title: 75pc of feedlot cattle now have access to shade, industry says
items.summary: Once seen as barren landscapes, feedlots across Australia have been reshaping their image. With industry encouraging its operators to install shade, uptake has been widespread.

items.title: Farm workers chase $260,000 in unpaid wages, some from major supermarket suppliers
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Paul Mescal on why we keep coming back to Shakespeare over 400 years later
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: NSW government unveils $3 billion plan to combat debris balls washing up on Sydney beaches
items.summary: The NSW Environment Protection Authority identified the Malabar wastewater treatment system as the origin of the debris balls plaguing beaches in Sydney.

items.title: Venezuelan opposition leader María Machado gifts her Nobel Peace Prize medal to Donald Trump
items.summary: The US president says he has accepted María Corina Machado's Nobel Peace Prize at a meeting in the White House, on account of "the work I have done".

items.title: Winemakers hit hard losing homes, vineyards and stocks in Victorian fires
items.summary: Two wineries in the Strathbogie Ranges have lost a combined 150 hectares of vines, 3,000 sheep and three homes in the Victorian fires.

items.title: Christmas Island welcomes 'twice-in-a-decade' return of millions of baby red crabs
items.summary: Wildlife officials on Christmas Island, the remote territory 2,600 kilometres north-west of Perth, are welcoming the final chapter of its famous red crab migration — the return to shore of millions of baby crabs.

items.title: Queensland family demands answers after grandmother dies from 'preventable' bloodstream infection
items.summary: Struggling to find answers about what happened in the week leading up to her death in hospital, Sue Smith's loved ones say they want hospitals to put more resources into investigating these types of incidents.

items.title: Storm Hunter fights tears after overcoming injury heartache to reach Australian Open main draw
items.summary: Storm Hunter books her spot in the main draw of the Australian Open — something that was inconceivable last year as she battled injuries that left her in tears mid-match.

items.title: European troops won't change Trump's ambition for Greenland, says White House
items.summary: As European countries send small numbers of troops to Greenland, the White House says their presence will not affect US President Donald Trump's ambitions for the island.

items.title: Wall Street rallies on Taiwan chips, Jim Chalmers backs Michele Bullock over US Fed chair — as it happened
items.summary: Federal Treasurer Jim Chalmers has come out in support of Michele Bullock after the Reserve Bank governor signed a joint statement in solidarity with Mr Powell, who is facing criminal prosecution driven by US President Donald Trump.

items.title: The NT's last private obstetrician walks away as maternity services face collapse
items.summary: A growing number of women in the Northern Territory are travelling interstate to give birth — or leaving the territory altogether — following the sudden closure of the only private hospital maternity ward. Now, the NT's last private obstetrician is closing her practice.

items.title: Hamnet's historical figures are brought to life, only to be robbed of depth
items.summary: Chloé Zhao's retelling of the life of William Shakespeare is on the fast track to the Academy Awards, but at times feels like Oscar-bait.

items.title: 'Apocalyptic Christian cult' Shincheonji using 'special force teams' to spread across the country
items.summary: Documents leaked to the ABC reveal an "apocalyptic Christian cult" is targeting Ballarat, Bendigo, Geelong and Darwin.

items.title: Finn Allen smashes maiden BBL century as Perth Scorchers book finals spot
items.summary: Finn Allen saves his best ever BBL innings for when it matters most as the Perth Scorchers out-duel the Melbourne Renegades.

items.title: Child slapped in the face among inappropriate educator discipline exposed in Canberra childcare document dump
items.summary: Documents detailing five years' worth of childcare breaches in the ACT reveal cases of educators slapping children, forcibly shaking them, throwing them, and possessing child exploitation material.

items.title: Who could lead Iran if the Islamic Republic falls?
items.summary: Names frequently raised include an exiled prince, a former president, and the leader of a leftist movement, but experts say no single figure has the power and legitimacy to take control alone.

items.title: Venezuelan families wait in hope for release of political prisoners
items.summary: Venezuela's new leader says political prisoners are being freed, but hundreds remain jailed, with families clinging to hope that America's intervention and ongoing pressure will eventually secure their loved ones' release

items.title: Rockhampton and Gulf Country communities brace for possible flooding
items.summary: Rockhampton is bracing for possible flooding while communities in the already-sodden Gulf Country fear they may be isolated for "a long time to come" as ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji threatens more rain.

items.title: Queensland woman wakes up to find carpet python on top of her
items.summary: It's fair to say when a Brisbane resident woke up to discover a carpet python curled up on top of her, she was rattled.

items.title: Former Whyalla steelworks owner's $18.5 million royalties debt revealed
items.summary: The former owner of the Whyalla steelworks, Sanjeev Gupta's OneSteel Manufacturing, owed $18.5 million in royalties when it was forced into administration last year, the ABC can reveal.

items.title: Hundreds of satellite images capture Victoria's destructive bushfires erupting
items.summary: Hundreds of images captured by an orbiting weather satellite, and stitched together by the ABC, show the scale and destructive force of the Victorian bushfires.

items.title: What is in the government's new hate speech laws?
items.summary: Parliament will return early next week to debate new hate speech laws. But what exactly does the legislation include?

items.title: Heated Rivalry and growing sports romance genre can teach lessons about queer inclusion
items.summary: Heated Rivalry has become a massive global hit, but can the steamy ice hockey romance, and other queer love stories, help create more inclusive spaces in the real sporting world?

items.title: Australia's notorious Bass Strait was once conquered by two men in a 4.5m dinghy
items.summary: With whisky and lollies for sustenance and pigeons their only means of communication, Steve Harris and Doug Fleming crossed Bass Strait in a 4.5m dinghy in 1974.

items.title: Great Ocean Road flash flooding leaves beach towns to count the cost
items.summary: The Lorne caravan park will be closed for weeks after record-breaking rains turned into "terrifying" floodwaters, sweeping cars into the ocean and inundating holiday parks along Victoria's Great Ocean Road.

items.title: Trump threatens to invoke Insurrection Act over Minnesota anti-ICE protests
items.summary: Such a move would allow the president to deploy troops to quell persistent protests in the city of Minneapolis, where two shootings connected to immigration crackdowns are fuelling public anger.

items.title: Pulp agree to Adelaide Festival show after apology to Randa Abdel-Fattah
items.summary: In a social media post, British indie band Pulp says it had previously informed festival organisers of its decision to withdraw but was asked "to delay an announcement while [organisers] sought to resolve this crisis for all sides", and it had now agreed to perform.

items.title: Antidepressants less effective for many living with atypical depression, new study finds
items.summary: A major Australian study finds standard antidepressants are not effective for about 20 per cent of people, who may need alternative treatments.

items.title: More than 4.7m social media accounts closed in two days after ban began, data reveals
items.summary: More than 4.7 million Australian social media accounts have been deactivated since laws banning children aged under 16 took effect in December, according to data released by the government.

items.title: NASA's Crew 11 Dragon splashdown upon returning to Earth
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Astronauts return from ISS with sick crew member
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Astronauts return from ISS with sick crew member
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Space station astronauts splash down after first-ever medical evacuation
items.summary: A capsule carrying four International Space Station crew members has splashed down in the Pacific, bringing their mission to an end more than a month early.

items.title: Ecologist Dr Faith Coleman steps down from government panels after allegations of political interference
items.summary: South Australian ecologist Dr Faith Coleman has resigned from two state government algal bloom panels and criticised the state government's approach.

items.title: Wikipedia is 25, but some old fights are still going
items.summary: Wikipedia is celebrating 25 years of the online encyclopedia and the enormous impact its had, while looking forward to its future. But some controversies from the past refuse to die.

items.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Bushfire relief payments cause confusion among Victorians in impact zones
items.summary: Residents from Victoria's bushfire-affected areas say they are confused over disaster relief payments, with a number of people saying they have been rejected for relief despite experiencing hardship.

items.title: Driver's licence suspended after dog dies in alleged hit and run
items.summary: A man's licence is suspended as police investigate the death of a dog in an alleged hit and run near Newcastle.

items.title: Alice Springs residents waiting 10 years for public housing while homes sit vacant
items.summary: Public housing in Alice Springs is sitting vacant and in disrepair while residents wait up to a decade to be allocated a home.

items.title: International Grammar School teacher Peter Adam in custody over child sexual abuse claims
items.summary: A Sydney school teacher accused of plotting the sexual assault of two children he was allegedly "pimping out" to another man is refused bail.

items.title: Three-year-old Ineza King dies following Banya truck crash
items.summary: A three-year-old girl who suffered critical head injuries in a horrific multi-vehicle crash last week in regional Queensland has died in hospital, with her family remembering her as a "beautiful spirit".

items.title: United Employment collapse leaves disability workers $6 million short in missing pay, super and entitlements
items.summary: Up to 500 workers are fighting to recoup pay, super and entitlements after the collapse of a large disability support provider operating in New South Wales.

items.title: Police investigating fraud claim against director of liquidated caravan manufacturer Zone RV
items.summary: The luxury caravan manufacturer will be wound up, with liquidators promising to step up their investigation into allegations against Zone RV director David Biggar.

items.title: Thanasi Kokkinakis pulls out of Australian Open singles, hopeful Special Ks can still play doubles
items.summary: Thanasi Kokkinakis has pulled out of the Australian Open singles before the draw could be announced after suffering a shoulder injury playing in Adelaide.

items.title: Behind Grok's mass digital undressing lies an 'unsurprising' cohort of 'men eager to violate women'
items.summary: The X AI is not creating sexually explicit images of women on its own, but the software "facilitates their abuse" acting on the requests of men "eager to violate women".

items.title: Anxious business owners fear collateral damage from WA's illegal tobacco violence
items.summary: Business owners neighbouring suspected illegal tobacco stores are calling for a crackdown amid a spate of violent incidents alleged to be targeting the illicit tobacco trade.

items.title: Dane Sweeny battles into Australian Open main draw
items.summary: A delighted Dane Sweeny will play in the Australian Open main draw for the second time after winning his third and final qualifying match.

items.title: Federal officer shoots man in leg in Minneapolis after being attacked during arrest, officials say
items.summary: A federal law enforcement officer has shot a man in the leg in Minneapolis after being attacked with a shovel and broom handle during an arrest, US officials say.

items.title: Greens won't support Labor's sweeping hate law reform in current form
items.summary: The Greens have thrown up a roadblock for Labor by declaring it will not support the government's sweeping changes to hate and gun laws without amendments as the Coalition also backs away from the reforms.

items.title: Man charged over alleged social media death threats against PM Anthony Albanese, NSW Premier Chris Minns
items.summary: WA Police charge a 19-year-old man after he allegedly uses social media to send messages, threatening to kill Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and NSW Premier Chris Minns.

items.title: Why Australia is investing in defence infrastructure at five military sites in the Philippines
items.summary: Experts say these agreements are clear signs of how important an ally the Philippines is becoming in the Indo-Pacific region amid jitters of US security guarantees.
